title: Business & Finance
text:
Three media firms tied to exiled Chinese businessman Guo Wengui agreed to pay $539 million to settle regulatory claims they violated investor-protection laws when they raised money from more than 5,000 investors.

---

The two main sponsors of the 2010 Dodd-Frank financial regulatory legislation said Biden should reappoint the Fed's Powell to a second term.

---

The price of litecoin, a little-used cryptocurrency, spiked before falling back after a news release touting a partnership with Walmart turned out to be fake.

---

Blackstone abandoned a $3.3 billion takeover of Chinese commercial-property developer Soho China.

---

Fox said it acquired celebrity news platform TMZ from AT&T 's WarnerMedia unit.

---

ViacomCBS unveiled a new management team and operating structure for Paramount Pictures .

---

The S&P 500 and Dow industrials rose 0.2% and 0.8%, respectively, while the Nasdaq slipped 0.1%.

---

Live Nation reached a new agreement to acquire Mexican concert promoter OCESA for about $450 million.

---

The National Association of Realtors sought to block a broad Justice Department probe of industry practices.
